caption: I was walking around Paris looking for a Gifi store and I found this lovely little garden. It's a little oasis in the centre of Paris. There was a kids area for them to play, elderly people walking around and reading, loads of trees and green which was nice to see. There are benches if you want to sit back, eat and rest. If you want a break from capitalism, then come to this place ðŸ˜Š
Lovely small park located at heart of temple. Went there to find people chilling and basking the sun on a Sunday evening. Has a small pond with ducks and a lot of benches

Nice space in public area around the 3rd arrondissement of Paris City. Calm place to sitting down a bit after long walk. Itâ€™s right in front of the bus stop Square du Temple, near by walking distance to MusÃ©e des Arts et Metiers, and many restaurants there.

Really lovely small jardin thatâ€™s clearly used by the local community and special groups. Great place to have a little sit with a coffee and take in the environment. I didnâ€™t see any rats but I know itâ€™s an issue. A place I regularly head to when in town.
Fun park for kids with plenty of places to sit in the shade.
A lovely garden park, located in the 3rd  Arr, plenty of seating to enjoy the salubrious surrounds.

A beautiful park in the center of the city with a little lake that makes it much more alluring than a simple city park. Beautiful flowers, trees and other plants surrounding the lake bring a botalical garden vibe to it. There is even a small wooden house in the lake for birds that live there. The park is almost always full of people and cheerful voices of children who are playing on a playground near the lake. The park is especially beautiful in the springtime with blooming trees and bushes and blue sunlit sky over it.

I found it by chance while I was shopping in the famous Rue de Bretagne after my visit to the Picasso Museum in the 3rd region of Paris (3Ã¨me arrondissement de Paris) Comfortable nature ! Very full of visitors!
Lovely small park with two ping pong and chess tables. There is always someone there to play with you. Nice and quiet even though it is very busy. We loved it here.

It's a lovely park popular with the locals who come to eat their lunch, mothers with their children playing in sand box and swings. There's even ping pong tables and bandstand for concerts starting in July.
A highlight of my all too brief time in this enchanting neighborhood, a complete orchestra performed on a warm Sunday afternoon - magical.

A great place to just relax and be away from the tourists. A hidden gem. Plenty of benches, a kids playground, and table tennis. I bought a croissant and was looking for a place to sit and eat. This was perfect.
Nice park, a bit under construction at the moment, very kid friendly and quiet. Groups of teens may hang out here but they're not disruptive or anything. :)

Enter the small park by mistake. It was twilight and we heard a singing going on. Inside, next to a small pavilion a choir of 15 people practiced a Beatles song. There is a small pond and beautiful gardening around it. Grab a coffee or a battle of wine and cheese and sit for city break.
Great little sand playground for kids.  No water fountains anywhere though which was lame.
Small park yet well organized and beautifully decorated. Excellent spot for a well deserved break.

Nice quiet park where you can sit on one of the many benches with food from one of the surrounding streets. There is a playground on the south end which can draw children and noise but it's part of the atmosphere. Good amount of trash cans and lovely setting.

An oasis of a park in the centre of Paris. A perfect place to sup coffee and eat a pastry. So much history took place at this location and aside from a small blurb on a plaque, no Monument to the history of France can be found. Hearing children play and their sounds of laughter was touching and poignant considering that in this park the boy-King Louis XVII spent his last miserable days. A marble statue should be erected in this park to the poor King who perished so cruelly at the hands of his jailers.
Have a nice time here. Perfect place to relax near the Marche des enfants rouge
Stumbled across this place on a walk after dinner. Very pleasant and beautiful buildings surrounding it.
Superbly kept small park with large bandstand and pretty flower. A breath of green space in the busy urban area. Great little playground for kids with a sandpit and slide.
Beautiful little park with a bit of water, lots of nice trees and benches in both sun and shade. The perfect spot to stop with your coffee and morning pastry!
Sweet little park, with a kid-friendly playground in a secluded area.
Loved this park, very lively with lots of people on every bench, even on a weekday. Also, lots of rats :)
Great little place, especially when sunny
Fantastic park in the Marais, great way for the kids to burn off some energy and play with French kids. There is a massive sand pit and climbing equipment
Top playground for children and toddlers. Also great place to have lunch or picnic in the summer.
Come here with some smacks and coffee when you want to have a city break
A lovely park in memory of Holocaust survivor Elie Wiesel. Walk through it when you're walking nearby! There is a pond and beautifully curated flowerbeds.
Such a pretty little park. We watched some locals play table tennis on their lunch break and a bunch of pigeons squabble over half a baguette.
Beautiful square nice flowers and kids park
I used to spend many hours here about a decade ago, such good memories. It's much more lush than it was then. It was nice to sit and enjoy the occasional breeze come through.
Great place to chill with friends... Suitable for family with childs thanks to a kid play ground assorted with benches.
A beautiful children's park dedicated to the memory of the late great Elie Wiesel. It's an oasis on a hot day.
Very quiet place with green areas, a little of homeless people but they are nice.
Small, cute, but too crowded most days.
Great playground for kids !
Nice little parc and nice playground for kids!
